questionsData.title: Salt is produced when acids and bases react.
Wood and glass are used to make windows.
We cannot see in a foggy weather.
Telescopes are used to study blood cells.
Plantation is a land planted with trees.
People with learning difficulties are those who learn easily.
A phrase to end a letter is "yours faithfully".
Chilli powder is a kind of spices.
Masts are used to hold the oars.
The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: The brain is the most (complex 1) organ in the (human 2) body. (It 3) produces our thought, action, memory, feeling and experience of the world. The jelly-like mass of tissues, weighs around 1.4 kilograms, contains one hundred billion nerve cells, or neurons. The complexity of the connectivity between these cells is great. Each neuron can make contact with thousands or even tens of thousands of others through tiny structure called synapses. No two brains are alike. It is often said that the right half of the brain is more creative and emotional and the left deals with logic. The two halves have some specializations, the left deals with speech and language, and the right with locations and body awareness. The mid brain and the brain stem control the unconscious functions such as breathing, heart rate, blood pressure, sleep pattern and so on. They also control signals that pass between the brain and the rest of the body through spinal cord
